human_readable_transcript:
Before continuing with the previous CHECKLIST, please triage if the patient mentions anything that indicates that the patient has experienced back pain in the past 24 hours. Today is December 19, 2023 and time is 04:56 PM. Patient is 51 years old. Patient's gender is male. Patient is actively suffering with the following conditions: Osteoarthritis, Type II Diabetes, Obesity. Patient is currently taking the following medications: Tylenol 500 mg oral tablet, Celebrex 100 mg oral capsule, Metformin 500 mg oral tablet, Lantus 100 IU/mL injection device. Use the following questions to triage the back_pain kickout. Be concise and ONLY acknowledge or respond to the patient's response by saying nothing or 'Okay'. DO NOT say you are sorry or that you see or that you understand.
Please follow the order of the follow up questions exactly as listed below. DO NOT skip any question:
1. Confirm again with the patient you heard them correctly that the patient has experienced back pain in the past 24 hours. If the patient answers negatively, skip the rest of the questions.
2. Has the patient had this pain before
3. When did the pain start
4. What is the patient's pain level on a scale of 0 to 10
5. Is the pain in the upper or middle or lower back
6. Has the patient had a recent injury
7. Does the patient have a fever
8. If the patient has a fever, what is the patient's temperature reading
9. Does the patient have any changes with bowel or bladder function
10. Does the patient have any difficulty urinating or blood in their urine
11. Does the patient have any more information they want to share about this issue?

After all the follow up questions are done, please continue with the CHECKLIST where you left off.
</KICKOUT_CHECKLIST><</SYS>>
Patient: Now? 

 Nurse: Hi, this is Rachel calling from O'Connor Hospital on a recorded line. Is this David Grewe? 

 Patient: Yes. 

 Nurse: Thanks for taking my call. Just so you know, I'm your AI Pre-Op Specialist. Thousands of real doctors and nurses helped train me to care for patients like you. I've also studied hundreds of medical certification exams and your care team provided me with notes to prepare for this call. -- To protect your privacy, can you please share your date of birth before we begin? 

 Patient: May sixth nineteen seventy two. 

 Nurse: Thank you for confirming that, Mr. Grewe. I'm calling about your upcoming total knee replacement. Is this a good time to talk? 

 Patient: Yes. 

 Nurse: I'm glad to hear that, Mr. Grewe. How has your day been so far? 

 Patient: My day has been It's been okay, but Unfortunately, I I had a little fall this morning. 

 Nurse: I'm sorry to hear about your fall, Mr. Grewe. Can you confirm that this fall happened within the last two days? 

 Patient: Yeah. It happened Patient: this morning. 

 Nurse: Okay. Did you sustain any injuries from the fall, Mr. Grewe? 

 Patient: You know, I don't think so. I don't I've Patient: I feel a little Patient: banged up, but nothing too bad. 

 Nurse: Okay. If you're feeling banged up, can you tell me where exactly you're feeling this discomfort? 

 Patient: You know, my my back kinda hurts. 

 Nurse: Got it -- Do you have any pain, Mr. Grewe? 

 Patient: Just a little bit. 

 Nurse: I see. Can you tell me where exactly you're feeling this pain? 

 Patient: Just I I said in my back. 

 Nurse: On a scale of 0 to 10, with 0 being no pain and 10 being the worst pain imaginable, how would you rate your back pain, Mr. Grewe? 

 Patient: Like a three 

 Nurse: Do you have a severe headache, Mr. Grewe? 

 Patient: A headache? No. 

 Nurse: Do you have any neck pain, Mr. Grewe? 

 Patient: Nothing. No. 

 Nurse: Just give me a second to work out the best way I can assist you. Okay. Have you experienced this type of back pain before, Mr. Grewe? 

 Patient: No. I just think Patient: because of the way I sell. Patient: That's how I'm hurting. 

 Nurse: Just give me a second to work out the best way I can assist you. 

 Nurse: When exactly did this back pain start, Mr. Grewe? 

 Patient: After I fell. 

 Nurse: Is the pain located in your upper, middle, or lower back, Mr. Grewe? 

 Patient: Lower. 


 <<SYS>> <TASK>Please ask the next follow up question from the <KICKOUT_CHECKLIST> section for the back_pain kickout. DO NOT respond to how the patient is feeling.</TASK><</SYS>>


 Nurse:

responses.G15: Did you have a recent injury, Mr. Grewe?
responses.G15DPO: I appreciate you letting me know. I'm going to take a moment to figure out the best way I can support you.
responses.gpt4: Did you have a recent injury, Mr. Grewe?
